characters: CAMERA HOLDS ON ROOM SERVICE WAITER
LYDIA, SCRIMSHAW, CANKER, IGOE, HENCHMEN AND SERVANTS
THREE MEN IN DARK BUSINESS SUITS
CAMERA MOVES IN TIGHT ON THE SYRINGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded cocktail party is in progress. Open bar and hug buffet table. A well-dressed, predominantly male crowd in attendance. Uniforms from all branches of the military ar in evidence everywhere. CAMERA PROWLS THROUGH the room picking up random bits of conversation. A TELEVISION NEWS CREW, reporting live from the scene, comes INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS CORRESPONDENT
dialogues.text: (into hand-held mike; facing mini-cam crew) ... Bob, I think that you and the viewers at home can see that this room behind me is packed to overflowing. Former astronauts, Space Shuttle crew members, Washington bigwigs, Pentagon officials... well, you name it and they're here in San Francisco tonight to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of NASA, the National Aeronautics and... CAMERA MOVES OFF, eventually finds: 2

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA MAXWELL
dialogues.text: A knockout brunette in her early thirties. She is engaged in earnest conversation with a man whose eyes are seen to wander over her anatomy as they talk. (We'll call him

dialogues.speaker: TUCK PENDELTON
dialogues.text: Emerging drunkenly into the banquet room from a door marked "No Admittance" and crashing head-on into a busboy with a loaded tray of dirty dishes. The busboy is knocked for a loop and the DISHES SMASH to the floor. Tuck reacts with inebriated indignation. the "No Admittance" sign. He points to

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: How come it says 'restrooms' when it's really the damn kitchen!?  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 2. The busboy looks baffled, and Tuck moves off with his dignity intact. Noticing that his glass is empty, he shoulders his way to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (to bartender) Cutty. Up. As he waits for his drink, we see that Tuck's rugged good looks are fading slightly and his once square jaw is in need of a closer shave. His Navy captain's uniform -stret several pounds have been added since the last fitting. As Tuck receives his drink from the bartender, a DISTURBA

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: (to Lydia; loudly) What are you doing!? That's a tape recorder! Roving Eyes indicates a small Sony protruding from Lydia' clutch purse.

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: You can't do that, young lady! Give that to me. He swipes the recorder from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Other partygoers turn and look. blaze. He storms over. So does Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (surprised to see him) Tuck!...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: What's the trouble, Lydia?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: He stole my tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: (to Tuck) She was recording my conversation!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I told you I worked for a newspaper. His eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 3.

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: This is a cocktail party, not a damn news conference!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (firmly) Give it back to me, please.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You heard the lady... hand it over! Roving Eyes looks startled by Tuck's abusive tone.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I said, hand it over... ya damn pencil-necked civilian! Suddenly, the room falls silent, and Tuck realizes that all eyes are upon him.

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: Captain, you're drunk. Tuck looks embarrassed. He looks down at his drink, then looks up again with a big, foolish grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Well... he's right. I'm drunk. (to Lydia) Guess I owe these folks an apology, Lydia. She puts her hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (softly) It's okay, Tuck. Forget it. Tuck pulls away from her.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (belligerently) Not until I apologize to these people! (for all to hear) We got some real famous, allAmerican hero-types with us tonight! Space-walkers, an' moonwalkers... an' Earth-orbi It's obvious who Tuck is talking about. They stand there in their crisp uniforms, with short hair, erect postures and disapproving expressions.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Gentlemen... (belch) ... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 4. Tuck is standing before a DISPLAY OF LARGE ROCKET MODELS charting the history of the space program.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (indicating one of the rockets) You boys have all gone up in these babies. Hats off to you. I envy you fellas... (beat) ... The most excitement I ever had was the time I landed a crippled F-14 on the deck of a rocking flattop in zero visibility with the nose gear -Tuck sees RUSTY, one of the ex-astronauts turn away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: -- Don't turn your back on me, Rusty... (beat) ... At least when my moment of truth came, I didn't take a dump down the leg of my flightsuit... if that rings any bells for you! Rusty looks enraged. He advances toward Tuck. But Tuck stands his ground -- smiles -- and drops Rusty with a hooking right fist. Uproar! TWO young MARINES rush up to Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MARINE
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Only two of you? Tuck raises his fists. The Marines exchange a look. They know that they have no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND MARINE
dialogues.text: Sorry, Captain. Pow! Tuck takes it on the chin. He goes tumbling backward other like falling dominos. Onlookers gasp and scream. The TV News Crew hurries over. and roll tape. They turn on their lights

dialogues.speaker: NEWS CORRESPONDENT
dialogues.text: (to Marine) Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 4A.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Captain Tuck Pendelton, ma'am. The News Correspondent looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS CORRESPONDENT
dialogues.text: (to crew) Kill it, boys. He's nobody. Tuck props himself up on one elbow and works his jaw. Lydia rushes to his side.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Oh, Tuck... are you all right? Tuck gives her a dazed expression. No one else offers assistance. They look upon Tuck as a complete disgrace. Then, one man comes forward. Dressed in a business suit. Tuck's own age. Clean cut. Athletic-looking. His name is PETE BLANCHARD. He offers Tuck his hand. Tuck looks up at Blanchard and smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Where's your uniform, Pete? Blanchard pulls Tuck to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: I grew up, Tuck. I wear a suit now. (beat) Take him home, Lydia. Lydia begins to lead Tuck away. But she leaves his side for a brief moment to snatch back her tape recorder from Roving Eyes' unsuspecting hands.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Pencil neck!

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: You should have your press credentials revoked!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Write a letter to your congressman! Lydia marches off, reclaims Tuck who waits for her on tottering legs, and heads for the door. Roving Eyes watches them go. beside him. Pete Blanchard comes up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 4B.

dialogues.speaker: ROVING EYES
dialogues.text: (to Blanchard) I am my congressman. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lydia emerge from the hotel, Tuck's arm draped around Lydia's shoulder for support.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: And you said you weren't coming tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 No. 5.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I said I wasn't invited. They approach the parking VALET. check. 5 Lydia hands him her claim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is slumped in the passenger seat as Lydia drives him home. She glances at him with a concerned expression.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Don't give me that look.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (innocently) What look?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: That 'Poor Pitiful Tuck' look. (beat) I had a great time tonight. I like getting drunk. I enjoy being hit in the face. Lydia rolls her eyes at Tuck's hopelessness. up the tape recorder from the car seat.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: What's on this, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I'm working on a story.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I should have guessed.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: It's a good story. (beat) Not that you'll ever know, of course. You never read any of my articles.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: That's not so. I read the one about me.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I think you only looked at the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Well, you gotta admit, those were great pictures. (strokes his face) Maybe I should grow that mustache back. Tuck picks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck takes a moment to mull this over, removing a pocket flask from beneath his uniform in the process. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Tell me about the story.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Espionage in Silicon Valley. The buying and selling of advanced technological secrets.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Hmm...

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: That's why I had my tape recorder with me. Every high-tech company on the West Coast was represented at that party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Well, you're right about one thing, Lydia... (takes a pull on the flask) ... I ain't gonna read it. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lydia enter. Tuck turns on a light. cramped, unkempt bachelor's den. The place is a Despite the usual clutter, Lydia notices right away a new element in the disarray: Biological charts, books and mod All of which pertain to the internal workings of rabbits! She picks up one of the models.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: What's this? Nothing. doing.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Just some homework I'm Tuck takes it from her hand and puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: How about a drink?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I can't stay, Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Just for a minute. (beat) I know what you'd like: I fix you some tea? Tea! Can  Revised 11/8/85 7. No, Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: I --
dialogues.text: Tuck goes into the kitchen, begins to rummage through the cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: What's tea come in again? A can? A jar? Wait... I remember. Little bags, right? Yeah... here they are.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (firmly) I'm not staying, Tuck. Tuck can see she means it. His expression turns serious.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Don't go, Lydia. Please stay. He puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Tuck -He begins to nuzzle her neck.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Mmmm. I love your perfume. What's it called again?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I don't wear perfume. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: What's it called again?... He's breaking down her resistance.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (softly) Midnight Lace.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Mmmmm. Smells so good. go, Lydia... He kisses her. 7 Don't She fights it -- but then melts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is asleep in bed, but Lydia is dressed. She's leavin She gives Tuck a farewell glance, then slips quietly out the room. But the slamming of the front door awakens Tuck. that Lydia is gone. He realizes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 8.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia?... Then, from outside the house, he hears her car engine GRO as it tries to fire up.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia! Tuck jumps from the bed. He's naked. He wraps the sheet around himself, then stubs his toe on the bed leg.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Owwww!! 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck hops out of the house, favoring his injured toe, hol the sheet around his waist. Lydia is inside her car, desperately trying to get it sta

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia! Wait! Tuck rushes up to the car window.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Where you going?!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (almost in tears) I'm leaving, Tuck. Don't try to stop me. Our relationship has no future, and you know it. You drink too much. You fight too much. You don't value anything. You destroy everything that's good in your life. You ruin it. You throw it away. And if I stayed any longer, I'd be next.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia -LYDIA -- You're a big, dumb Palooka, Tuck, and I know I love you, but I don't think we should see each other again for a long, long time. With that, Lydia drives off in a cloud of white exhaust s Tuck stands in the street, in the dawn's early light, clu alone.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Two Months Later 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK PUTTER sits on the examination table. -looking fellow in his mid-thirties. He's an agreeable DR. GREENBUSH leans against the counter, arms folded acro his chest in an attitude of nonchalance that approaches t disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (indicating his stomach) ... Feels like it starts about here, then swoops around and comes up to here, then -- zoom! -- heads back down to about here, and that's when I start to feel nauseous and... Greenbush tries unsuccessfully to stifle a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Am I boring you?

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: No, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Because if I'm boring you, just tell me. You're not the only internist in the phone book, you know.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Jack, please! Let's not have a falling out. Your monthly office visit is the cornerstone of my entire medical practice. (beat) Anything besides the nausea? Headaches. headaches.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Big, pounding Lots of pain. Headaches.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Okay. Anything else? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The dream.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Hmmm.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 10.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Want to hear it?

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm at work. I'm at the market. I'm working one of the registers. The next customer is this lady with bright orange hair, Mrs. Mulrooney. She's a regular. She's wearing those pointy -you know -- Harlequi With little sparkly things in them. And a lime green jumpsuit with a three-inch wide red vinyl belt.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Very vivid.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I have the same dream every night. (beat) Anyway, I'm passing her stuff over the bar-code scanner, and I don't notice it, but the computer's gone nuts, and it's ringing up all the wrong prices. I mean, twelve-hundred dollars for a can of coffee! So when I'm all done, I look at the register and the total's like way over a hundred thousand dollars. (beat) So Mrs. Mulrooney says to me, real calm, 'I don't carry that kind of money on me, sweetie, will you take this instead'... (beat) ... And she reaches down into her purse and comes out with a 357 Magnum this long and shoves the barrel into my face and pulls back on the trigger -- and that's when I wake up screaming!... Yeah. The sweat is pouring off Jack's face. him impassively. Greenbush regards

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: That it? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: I won't think anything until we run the usual tests. Slip out of those clothes, would you? With that, Greenbush exits the exam room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, wearing his streetclothes, sits in front of Greenbu desk. Greenbush bustles into the office with Jack's test results under his arm. Jack regards him anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: You're fine, Jack. I can't find anything wrong with you. Jack looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Everything checks out. Jack can't believe his ears. money back. He seems ready to demand his

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: You are under a lot of stress, however. You're way too uptight, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Uptight? Are you sure that's the correct medical term?

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Look -- do you have any vacation time coming? You need a rest. Get away for some R & R. Peace and Quiet -- that's my prescription for you. 12

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON JACK
dialogues.text: Thinking it over. 13 Doesn't sound like such a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VW Bug speeds into the parking lot of a Ralph's Market. Jack jumps from the car and races towards the entrance. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very busy. Many shoppers. Jack hurries into the market and grabs his apron. A name tag clipped to it reads:

dialogues.speaker: ASST. MANAGER
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 12. As Jack ties the apron behind his back, MR. WORMWOOD, the market manager, comes up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: Jack, where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Wormwood. appointment. Doctor's

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: (concerned) Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm fine. (rubs his temples) Do you have any aspirin on you? 15

dialogues.speaker: CHECK-OUT AISLES
dialogues.text: Jack walks down the row of check-out aisles, looking to s where he can lend a hand. He stops at the aisle where WEN an attractive young blonde, is working the register. Jack begins to bag Wendy's customer's groceries, ever so often stealing a glance her way. Eventually:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (softly) We had a date last night, you know?

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (louder) Our date. Last night.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: (snapping at him) I forgot. Okay? You forgot?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How could you forget?

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Look, Jack, I told you already, if you're gonna be a part of my life, you can't hassle me about stuff. Jack gives her a long, baffled look.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wendy... I'm not a part of your life. To which Wendy merely shrugs her shoulders and SNAPS her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 16 13.

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCE DEPARTMENT
dialogues.text: DR. DAVID NILES pushes a shopping cart between the crates fresh vegetables. He's a studious young man with dark wav hair and tortoise-shell glasses. There is another man with him. We recognize this man as P Blanchard, from the NASA cocktail party. Blanchard seems at ease and very much out of place in these surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Great place to have a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Good as any. (beat) Do these bananas look ripe to you?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Let's get to the point, all right?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Okay. (long pause) We've made a breakthrough.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: The satellite missile guidance system.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Uh... we haven't perfected that just yet. We got a bit sidetracked. Blanchard draws back apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: I'm talking about the world in an eyedropper. Blanchard looks baffled. Niles wheels his cart toward the produce bins. Blanchard hurries along beside him.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Miniaturization. We can shrink anything. Right down to the size of -(looks around, finds a peapod) -- a pea. (beat) Even smaller than that. Blanchard seems skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 14.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: We brought in Ozzie Wexler. The name draws a blank with Blanchard.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: The man who invented Action Man, the 3-D video game.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Action Man didn't work!

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Yes it did. (beat) The bottom dropped out of the video market, that's all. The public never gave it a chance. Blanchard seems totally exasperated and pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Come and see for yourself what we've done. All right. better have I'm pulling your entire

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Set it up. But you something, Niles, or the plug on you and misfit operation. With that, Blanchard marches off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning traffic crawls along a freeway interchange. and mist hang in the air. Smog CAMERA LOCATES a rambling, one-story industrial complex in the shadow of a freeway overpass. 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chain link fence surrounds the property. fence reads: A sign on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 19 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab looks cluttered and disorganized. A labyrinth of wires and cables snake across the floor. The numerous pieces of scientific equipment look exposed, functional and well used. In the center of the lab stands a large, impressivelookin Youthful LAB TECHNICIANS wearing photo-ID badges go about their business with obvious enthusiasm. OZZIE WEXLER is being videotaped by another Lab Technician.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: (into video camera) Uh... experiment number 27-G-5000. Time... eight-hundred hours. Date ... 5-26. (clears his throat) A full-grown human male will be placed inside a submersible pod of the type used in deep sea exploration, miniaturized, and introduced into the system of a living organism, in this case, the system of a common Lepus Cuniculus, or: white laboratory rabbit... Ozzie stops, notices that the Lab Tech has pointed the video camera away.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Panning to the rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Don't pan anywhere! camera on me. Keep the The Lab Tech pans back to Ozzie, who continues:

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Miniaturization is achieved through the pairing of two 5000Series Photon Echo Memroy called 'PEMS' for short. (holds up both chips) The two chips are intergrated, but electronically opposed. Only one is necessary for miniaturization, but both are required for re-enlargement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 A BELL RINGS. HORN SOUNDS. 16. Lights flash.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. SYSTEM VOICE
dialogues.text: Zero minus fifteen, Oz.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: (to Lab Tech) Keep rolling. I want a record of everything. 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck Pendelton is alone in the room. He wears a Navy blue jumpsuit and sits on a bench with the same pensive expression of a football player before the big game. He rises. himself. Goes to a mirror over the sink and looks at The door BANGS open and Ozzie enters. jumps at the noise. Startled, Tuck

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Nervous? Tuck makes no reply. jumpsuit. Ozzie sees a bulge under Tuck's

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Do you really need that? Tuck removes a flask from his pocket -- pauses to conside

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Okay? Ozzie nods his head, but then sees Tuck return the flask to his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: You're taking it anyway?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I have to. (beat) It's my lucky flask. Ozzie sighs to himself in resignation.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Now remember -- trust your on-board computer. Use it. I know you've studied, but don't rely on yourself when you don't have to. The computer's been programmed to answer any question you might have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 17.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should review our objects one more time.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I know what our objectives are. Retrieve tissue samples and test efficiency of surgical laser beam. (beat) Look, Oz... I know I'm no prize, but I'm the only one you could get. And this mission's the only one I could get. So let's just get the job done.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. SYSTEM VOICE
dialogues.text: Zero minus ten. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Ozzie come down the corridor. Tuck holds his helmet under his arm. He looks like he's walking "the last mile." The corridor is lined with boxes of 3-D Action Man games. Many of them stamped, "Return for Refund," or "Defective, or "Discontinued Series." Tuck glances at the boxes. Ozzie sees this. It shakes his confidence.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: (defensively) The game works! It's not my fault the public lost interest in video! They round a bend in the corridor and emerge into: 22

dialogues.speaker: THE LAB
dialogues.text: Buzzing with activity. Technicians man their stations.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. SYSTEM VOICE
dialogues.text: Zero minus eight. Tuck and Ozzie approach the geodesic dome. It looms up for Tuck like the Matterhorn. Something catches in his throat. His heart skips a beat. They draw closer and closer to the dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 23 17A.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DOME
dialogues.text: Tuck and Ozzie enter, followed by several lab Techs. contrast to the lab without, the dome is clean and orderly. Its translucent panels gently diffuse the light. In Tuck's eyes lead us to... 24

dialogues.speaker: THE POD
dialogues.text: Resting on a platform several feet above the floor. A gracefully-molded, teardrop-shaped white Fiberglass subme top-mounted floodlights and articulating arms. An expansive glass viewing dome wraps around the pod's cockpit. 25

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: approaches the Pod.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Good luck, Captain. A Technician opens the Pod's hatch and Tuck climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Just get me home again before my air runs out. Don't worry. supply.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: You've got a 24-hour

dialogues.speaker: P.A. SYSTEM VOICE
dialogues.text: Zero minus five. The hatch is closed and locked. 26

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL
dialogues.text: is a panel of monitors and terminals outside the dome. Ozzie takes his place behind the main controls.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: (to Ozzie) Dr. Niles and Mr. Blanchard aren't here yet.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: That's just too bad. (slips on headset) Do you read me, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 27 17B.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE POD
dialogues.text: Tuck straps himself into the body-contoured swivel seat. He is surrounded by computer terminals, display monitors, switches, lights and instruments.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Loud and clear, Oz. 28

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Zero minus three.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Engage PEM number one.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST PEM
dialogues.text: (a chip no bigger than a postage stamp) is snapped into a complex circuit board. Several Technicians, using perfect calibrated instruments, must oversee its precise placemen

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: PEM Number One functional.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Engage PEM Number Two. 30

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PEM
dialogues.text: is snapped into place on a portable circuit module with t same care and precision as the first chip. The module is then inserted into an opening in the nose of the Pod itse

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: PEM Number Two functional.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Activate Miniaturization Sphere. 31

dialogues.speaker: THE MINIATURIZATION SPHERE
dialogues.text: (resembling a giant fishbowl made of smoked glass) descen from the top of the dome and is slowly lowered into place over the Pod. 32

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE POD
dialogues.text: Tuck watches the dark sphere slowly engulf him, shutting all but the brightest laboratory lights. He switches on the Pod's interior lights. soft green luminescence. They glow with a

dialogues.speaker: TECH'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Zero minus one and counting!

dialogues.speaker: "BUGS"
dialogues.text: The laboratory white rabbit. Wires from several terminals embedded under its skin connect to monitors and display screens. Bugs' nose twitches nervously.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ... fifteen seconds... fourteen seconds... thirteen seconds, (etc.) --

dialogues.speaker: THE LAB
dialogues.text: The atmosphere is charged with a sense of purpose, dedica and the adventure of true scientific discovery.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: ... two seconds... one second... Zero Seconds. Ozzie presses a flashing yellow button, and -- 35

dialogues.speaker: THE MINIATURIZATION SPHERE
dialogues.text: begins to glow brightly. silhouette. The Pod inside becomes a brilliant Ultra high-powered laser tubes bombard the sphere with be of multi-colored light. 36

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE POD
dialogues.text: Tuck wears a green-visored helmet to protect his eyes fro the blazing lights. 37

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS MONITORS
dialogues.text: Four different 3-D images of the Pod are displayed: frame image. A solid-model image. An X-ray image. generated image. A wireA heat- In all four cases it is very clear to us that the Pod is decreasing in size! 38

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Twenty percent reduction... fifty percent reduction... seventy-five percent reduction... we now have full reduction.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Raise the sphere. The Miniaturization Sphere is raised -- and the Pod has seemingly disappeared. Everyone breathes a communal sigh of relief as small, congratulatory smiles are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: Nice work, team. Now let's get the Pod into the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK plays. Shoppers stroll. Teenagers hang out. Jack Putter goes up the escalator to the second level. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CUSTOMER is examining several cameras.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Now this one is fully automatic.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. In the b.g., we see Jack walk by. 41

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: pauses to look into the window of a Travel Agency. advertising Mexican cruises are featured. Posters Jack enters the agency. 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is seated next to the desk of a WOMAN TRAVEL AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: ... Fun, romance, excitement, relaxation -JACK -- I'll take relaxation.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: It's a cruise -- you get them all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No excitement. Doctor's orders.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Ah, but you're a single young man. (beat) What about romance?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As long as it isn't too exciting. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several TELEPHONE UTILITY TRUCKS pull up and park in the parking lot. Telephone Company REPAIRMEN pile out wearing hardhats and coveralls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange cones are placed on the ground around the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 44 21.

dialogues.speaker: ORANGE CONE
dialogues.text: as it is set down on the pavement. Somehow, this innocent act conveys a stong feeling of malevolence. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A computer-operated robotic arm places a hypodermic syrin filled with pinkish fluid beneath the lens of a powerful scanning electron microscope. All technicians defer to Ozzie who is accorded the first look. He enters the dome and peers through the binocular-viewing eyepiece of the microscope. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pod! Floating in the pink solution. visible at the helm of the craft. 47 Tuck clearly

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: looks out the viewing dome at the strangely-shaped and colored globules that float past his Pod.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (softly) Ho-ly shit. (into mike) Oz... I think you did it, boy. I'm little. I'm shrunk right down to nuthin'. 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of TELEPHONE company REPAIRMEN enter the lobby. TWO security GUARDS are there. One sits behind a security command station desk where ten or more video monitors display different locations around the complex.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: What's the trouble, boys?

dialogues.speaker: TELEPHONE REPAIRMAN
dialogues.text: No trouble... The Guard looks puzzled, and the Repairmen slip on gas masks in unison.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey -- what is this? The Repairmen are suddenly holding what appear to be road flares. The flares produce a billowing PURPLE SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 22. The Second Guard reaches for his gun, but his movements wind down like SLOW MOTION. The Repairmen (who we shall now call THE INTRUDERS) toss the flares to the floor and enter the lab unmolested, as the entrance lobby fills with purple smoke. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Intruders stride down the corridor. Several of them begin to snap together automatic rifles as they go. 50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK SEDAN pulls up and parks a short distance away from the telephone company trucks. 51

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: Two men sit in front. A THIRD sits alone in the back. His power window glides down. The man is: 52

dialogues.speaker: MR. IGOE
dialogues.text: Steel-blue eyes. Shor blond hair. Year-round tan. Rugged with psychotic tendencies. 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Intruders enter. For a moment they go unnoticed by the busy Lab Techs. Then: the flares are produced and thrown in all directions. One flare lands directly under the nose of the Technician at the mission control panel. Purple smoke begins to swirl in the air. Technicians begin to protest, but very quickly their eyes glaze over, their movements slow and their voices slur.

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER ONE
dialogues.text: Where's the chip?

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER TWO
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER ONE
dialogues.text: Get it. The chip is ripped from the circuit board. walks toward the dome. 54 Intruder One

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE INSIDE THE DOME
dialogues.text: can see the silhouette of the approaching Intruder outsid His expression fills with alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 55 23.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE DOME
dialogues.text: The Intruder smiles to himself and unleashes a FUSILLADE of GUNFIRE at the dome. 56

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DOME
dialogues.text: Ozzie flinches as the Plexiglass dome begins to disintegr down on him. He crouches behind the big microscope for protection. Then, glancing up at the hypodermic syringe under the microscope's lens, he makes a decision: He grabs the syringe, kicks open the dome's hatchway, and makes a dash for it. 57

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE DOME
dialogues.text: Ozzie emerges on the side away from the Intruders. They don't see him. He stays low, holding a handkerchief to his nose and mouth, darts between a few large pieces of equipment, and escapes. The Intruders, meanwhile, have the Technicians lined up before them. They regard their captors with dopey, bewild side. An Intruder takes the videotape camera from one of the Techs.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Who are you?...

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER
dialogues.text: I'm yer mother. The Tech looks confused. He makes an effort to understand to focus his eyes. And slowly, the Intruder transforms for him into: THE IMAGE OF HIS MOTHER. A sweet, gray-haired old lady.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: (smiling) Mom... But "mom" is carrying an automatic rifle in her arms. She swings up the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Mom?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 58 59 23A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXPLODING into GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white rabbit. Twitching and trembling at the sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie emerges from a side door into the bright light of d He stops, looks in all directions -- then runs off. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe sees Ozzie running across the parking lot in the dis toward a parked motorcycle. He hops on, kicks the starter The ENGINE ROARS up -- he SQUEALS out across the parking

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Get him! 62

dialogues.speaker: THE VECTOR-SCOPE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Ozzie speeding off and the Black Sedan burning rubber in an effort to catch up. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie zooms down the street, but the Black Sedan begins t gain on him. Now -- the Black Sedan pulls up beside him. The rear wind lowers and an Uzi handgun is pointed at Ozzie. Ozzie sees the gun -- reacts by making a sharp turn to th right. Tires SQUEAL, dust flies. The Black Sedan speeds p But now Ozzie finds himself traveling up a 64

dialogues.speaker: FREEWAY OFF RAMP
dialogues.text: He dodges several cars coming down the ramp. 65 HORNS HONK.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: makes a sharp U-turn in the street -- ROARS up the Off Ramp in pursuit of Ozzie. An EIGHTEEN-WHEELER barrels down the ramp. Its AIR HORN sounds. The Black Sedan swerves -- just missing a major head-on -- and proceeds up the ramp. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie shoots onto the freeway going 80 m.p.h. in the wron direction. He hugs the freeway's shoulder, but oncoming traffic speeds past him at 65 m.p.h. with only inches of daylight to spare. The Black Sedan is not far behind -- also racing along th shoulder of the roadway.  25. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the three men inside, only Igoe is without fear.

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Run him off the road.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Run him off! Igoe leans forward and takes charge of the steering wheel He yanks hard to the right. 68

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: swings out into the first freeway traffic lane, side-bysi 69

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: looks over. 70 Can't believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: stays in the traffic lane. Fortunately, there are no oppo vehicles immediately approaching. 71

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: Igoe yanks the wheel to the left. 72

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: swirves toward Ozzie. 73

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: gives the motorcycle the gas and it leaps forward. The Bl Sedan's front bumper just grazes the cycle's rear fender. Ozzie almost loses control -- the motorcycle swerves dangerously to one side.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MOVES IN TIGHT ON THE SYRINGE
dialogues.text: poking out from the pocket of Ozzie's lab coat. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is being buffeted about mercilessly. with the Pod's control sticks. He struggles  26.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Hey! What's going on out there! Ozzie, come in. Can you hear me? 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OIL TANKER bears down on the Black Sedan. the same traffic lane. 76 Both occupy

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: Igoe's henchmen begin to WHIMPER. the steering wheel. Igoe has control of The Oil Tanker is getting closer and closer. Igoe gnashes his teeth in frustration and reluctantly swerves back ont the freeway's shoulder, behind Ozzie. 77

dialogues.speaker: THE OIL TANKER
dialogues.text: Whizzes past, with only inches to spare. 78

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: All three men suddenly see a freeway CALL BOX dead ahead. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie swerves to miss the Call Box. The Black Sedan brakes -- skids and squeals -- but can't stop in time. BAM! The Call Box is sheared off, and goes flying over the sedan's roof. 80

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE
dialogues.text: speeds into the lead, and exits the freeway... this time using an ON RAMP to do so. 81

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: resumes its pursuit, barrels down the On Ramp. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie ROARS by. 83 The Black Sedan soon follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie turns into the parking lot. likewise. 84 The Black Sedan does

dialogues.speaker: OVERHEAD VIEW OF PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: The motorcycle is much more nimble and quick, cutting in out of parking lanes, leaving the Black Sedan in its dust  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 85 27.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: Stops. Igoe jumps out, steadies his arm on the doorframe and aims his pistol -- BANG! 86 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flies out from under him, skids across the pavement and crashes. But Ozzie gets to his feet and runs toward the Mall Entrance.

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: jumps back into the Black Sedan. 88

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: ROARS down the parking aisle -- jumps the curb and comes to rest directly in front of the Mall Entrance. Igoe and his Henchmen dash into the Mall. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Customer still hasn't decided which camera to buy. The Clerk begins to load film into one of them.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: The best thing to do is to try it out. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes hands with the travel agent, then gets to his

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mr. Putter. Jack smiles uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well... I didn't think it'd be this expensive, but...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You're going to have a wonderful time. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe and his Henchmen run into the mall. Igoe screws a silencer onto the barrel of his pistol and looks in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: (pointing) There!  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 92 93 94 95 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is just barely glimpsed getting into the glass elevator to the second level. The doors are closing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: swings up his PISTOL with lightning speed and FIRES -PHHH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: makes it on board the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: IGOE AND HIS HENCHMEN
dialogues.text: hurry towards an escalator a short distance down the mall 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie is alone. His face ashen. Sweat beads on his forehead. Something is very wrong. 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes look glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack emerges from the travel agency, glancing down at his cruise brochures as he walks. He moves towards the elevat Meanwhile, the Customer and Clerk step out of the Camera The Customer holds the camera in his hand. Go ahead. 98

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Give it a try.

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: doesn't stand still on the escalator. He pushes past other shoppers in his hurry to reach the second level. 99

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: arrives at the elevator. 100

dialogues.speaker: HE CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: swings the camera around, and -- for the want of anything better to shoot -- points it at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: How 'bout that auto-focus! 101

dialogues.speaker: HE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: open... and Ozzie stands there tottering on rubber legs. Jack looks at him -- is taken aback by his appearance. Then Ozzie pitches forward and Jack catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 29.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: The Customer captures the moment on film. 102

dialogues.speaker: OZZIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: holding the hypodermic syringe. His arms wrap around Jack waist, and with his last dying breath he injects the pink fluid into Jack's butt. 103

dialogues.speaker: THE POD
dialogues.text: is thrusted powerfully forward with the equivalent force of fifteen G's as the pink fluid rushes around it. 104

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: is SLAMMED back into his seat by the unexpected burst of Unprepared for such a tremendous acceleration, he blacks 105

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: feels the sting of the needle. He tries to turn. drops to the floor -- unseen by Jack. The syringe Shoppers begin to SCREAM and SHRIEK: The back of Ozzie's lab coat is soaked with blood. Jack lowers him gently to the floor as a crowd begins to gather. 106

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: arrives. Sees that Ozzie is dead. syringe lying on the floor. Then he spots the empty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all the excitement, no one notices him pick it up and put it into his pocket. Nor do the Henchmen have any trouble stealing the camera away from the distracted Customer. 107

dialogues.speaker: THE MALL
dialogues.text: Everyone is rushing to the second level. come running. Security Guards Igoe and his Henchmen are conspicuous in that they are the only ones walking in the opposite direction. 108

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: just stands there over Ozzie's body wearing a bewildered expression on his face. 109

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Unconscious. Head slumped against his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's VW Bug speeds into the parking lot. 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzzing with activity. Wormwood grabs him. Jack dashes in, pale and sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: What now? Another doctor's appointment?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Wormwood. You wouldn't believe what happened to me this morning.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: You're right -- I wouldn't. Jack takes the apron and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: (calling after him) You're not on vacation yet, you know! 112

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: passes Wendy, clerking on Aisle Two.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hi, Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Jesus -- you okay?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, I...

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Because you look like shit. Jack cringes, tries to comb his hair with his fingers. 113

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: grabs the store p.a. system microphone.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: Check-lane Three is now open to all shoppers. Immediate service on Aisle Three. Five or six shoppers, with overflowing carts, charge towa Aisle Three. A massive pile-up is only nearly averted.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 114 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck begins to regain consciousness. His eyes open, and focus slowly. He shakes the cobwebs from his head, then looks out the viewing dome. 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, hollow tunnel filled with fluid and floating red and white donut-shaped globules.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Blood cells! (NOTE TO READER: When picturing sequences "inside imagine the darkness of the ocean floor. The only light being the Pod's own flood lamps. The effect terious and claustrophobic -- with the everpresent reverberating in the distance.) 116 the body," source of is mysheart beat

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (into mike) Mission Control, come in. Can you read me? What the hell's goin' on out there? I think I blacked out. Am I inside Bugs, or what? (pauses for reply) Ozzie. Come in. Do you copy? (still no reply) What's wrong with this damn radio!? 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. MULROONEY (looking just as Jack described her in his dream -- orange hair, harlequin sunglasses and all) swings her cart into Jack's check-out lane. Jack sees her. He looks a little worried. Mrs. Mulrooney begins to pile her selections onto the conveyor belt. They move slowly toward Jack. 118

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (into mike) Mission Control, if you can hear me -- I'm gonna try to restore radio contact by activating one of these electromagnetic booster cells. (beat) Here it comes, Oz. Hold on to your socks. Tuck hits the booster button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 119 32/33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUZZZZZZZ! A strong Electromagnetic Charge is emitted from the Pod in the form of a BRILLIANT BLUE LIGHT. 120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Electromagnetic Charge begins to play havoc with Jack Bar-Code scanner. The register begins to record inaccurat prices: Twenty-five hundred for a loaf of bread. Six-thousand for can of dog food. Fifteen-hundred buys a box of Raisin Bra 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUZZZZZ! BUZZZZZ! Two more jolts of Electromagnetic energy are emitted.  34.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: If this doesn't put radio transmission back on line, nothing will. 122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, and everyone surrounding him, have become aware of computer "glitch." The total on the register reads: $128, Jack looks dazed. All color is drained from his face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The dream... it's the dream... the dream has come true... Wormwood arrives to take charge, glances at the register. Jack!

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: What have you done!?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's the dream...

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: The what?! Wendy comes over to look.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Boy, Jack... way to screw up!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MULROONEY
dialogues.text: (to Jack) Listen, sweetie, I don't carry that kind of cash around on me. The line rings bells in Jack's head... then his eyes widen in horror as Mrs. Mulrooney reaches inside her purs

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh, no... here comes the gun. But she only removes a pack of cigarettes and lights up. Jack breathes a deep sigh of relief and grabs his head.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Wormwood) I need some aspirin -(takes hold of his lapels) -- please! I beg you for an aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: (slapping Jack's hand away) Unhand me, Putter!  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 35. In desperation, Jack grabs a bottle of Bayer Aspirin from Mrs. Mulrooney's purchases, pops off the top, discards th cotton and puts the bottle to his lips as if to chug-a-lu the tablets. Hey!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MULROONEY
dialogues.text: I'm not buyin' those aspirin now.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: At eight-hundred dollars a bottle, who'd want to! LAUGHTER from other shoppers. Wormwood fumes. He rips the aspirin bottle from Jack's hand -- tablets go flying acro the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: Get ahold of yourself, Jack! You're coming unglued! You're coming apart at the seams! Jack stares back at Wormwood with a glazed, uncomprehendi expression. Wormwood is alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: My god... he's completely spaced-out.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: I'll handle this -She steps forward and SLAPS Jack across her might. Jack's head spins halfway around.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Snap out of it, Jack! 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck gives up on the radio. to think. He leans back in his chair

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Great! No radio. No communication. I'm completely cut off. (pause) If only I could see out. Hmmm... maybe I can. He turns to the computer and flips a number of switches. The COMPUTER begins to glow and HUM.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Oz said this thing can answer any question I have... (to Computer) ... Hey, you... can I see out through the eyes of this beast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 36.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan, Stan. Tuck does a double-take.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Huh??

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: We can patch into the optic nerve. Intercept the electrical impulses going to the brain. Great.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: How do I find it?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: You want directions?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Say... didn't you prepare for this mission?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Do I have to defend myself to a machine!? Let's have the directions!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Keep your eye on the screen, Player Number One, begin the first level... and good luck!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Swell! It's built out of old video games. The Computer "tunes up" like an arcade game and the monitor begins to display the map Tuck needs.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Take radial artery to axillary artery to internal jugular vein to frontal sinus to... 124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits in a chair, recovering. He rests one arm on Wormwood's desk. Wormwood stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: I know I lost my temper, Jack. I'm sorry. You've been like a son to me -(MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 37.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) -- well, a nephew, anyway. You've got a big future in retail food marketing, and I'd hate to see you blow it now by going psycho on us. Wendy enters with a cup of coffee. appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Coffee! Great, Wendy. just what I need. Jack looks up, smiles That's But Wendy didn't bring it for Jack. She sips it herself.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: There's more down the hall if you want some. Jack just shakes his head, resigned to her indifference.

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: Jack... go home. Get some rest. Start your vacation today, and come back to us a new man. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Wormwood. Jack rises from his chair -- discovers that the arm he was resting on Wormwood's desk is covered with paper clip Jack looks puzzled. He tries to brush them off, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: God, Jack -- what now? Suddenly, Wendy's metal coffee spoon flies out of her hand and sticks to Jack's chest with a resounding THUD. Wormwood pries it off -- and it snaps right back!

dialogues.speaker: WORMWOOD
dialogues.text: Good lord... the guy's a living magnet! 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begins to get a picture on the Computer's display monitor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! here...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I'm getting a picture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 126 37A.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: As it begins to broadcast Jack's POV -- which at this moment consists of Wendy and Wormwood looking at him with astonished expressions. Of course, there is no sound.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Who the hell are they?! And where am I?! 127

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: lifts his arm to look at the paper clips that cling to it 128

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: sees the human arm come INTO VIEW... and he realizes that

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I'm in a man! (almost panics) I'm in a strange man, in a strange room, surrounded by strangers! (beat) How'd I get inside a man!? What happened to the rabbit!? I studied up on rabbits! (begins to calm down) Okay, Tuck... get a grip on yourself. We've got a little snafu here, as we say in the military. (Damn! Why'd I pour that scotch down the sink!?) Okay, okay. Think clear; stay cool. Tuck takes a moment to consider his options -- then sprin into action.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I gotta talk to this guy! (turns to Computer) I need directions to the inner ear.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: (sounding put-out) So, now it's the ear you want? Yes! Now!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Right now!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Okay, Player Number One... it's your quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 129 37B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pod floats into the Middle Ear: tening cavity that dwarfs the Pod. An enormous, glis- The Pod's articulating arms fasten a small electronic device to the eardrum. 130

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack behind the wheel. He feels a strange sensation in his ear. It tickles. He shakes his head, then scratches his ear with a finger. 131

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack fills his VW's tank. Nearby, two thirteen-year-old BOYS put air into their bike tires. The young STATION ATTENDANT leans against a pump drinking a Coke. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Jack turns toward the Boys, sees that they are occupied in their task. He shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Respond if you can hear me.  Revised 11/8/85 38. Jack now turns toward the Attendant.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You talking to me? The Attendant just gives Jack a blank look and continues to sip his Coke. It works.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I can hear you. Jack turns fast toward the Boys.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay, fellas -- what's the joke?

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: Huh?...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: This is no joke. Jack looks startled. The voice is not coming from the Boys at all. He turns back toward the Attendant.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Me, what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's you.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Yeah, it's me all right. me all my life. I been The Boys laugh. The Attendant trades a look with them. Jack is befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm not out there. I'm in here! In here??

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where's in here?!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: In you. In your body! They put me in you instead of the rabbit. Why'd they do that? Jack can't believe what he's hearing. A lunatic smile of madness registers on his face and he lets out a shriek of HYSTERICAL LAUGHTER. Now the Attendant looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 39.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You okay, fella?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. However, I've apparently just gone insane!! He jumps back into his car and SQUEALS away. 132

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling down the external auditory canal toward the external ear opening.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Hey, pal... how come I get the sinking feeling that you don't know what's going on any more than I do? 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, looking very agitated, sits on the examination table. Greenbush approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: A little voice inside your ear, huh? Okay, Jack, let's just have a look and see... Greenbush raises his ear-exam flashlight to Jack's ear. 134

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brilliant, searing light streams into the ear canal with blinding intensity. Tuck SCREAMS and grabs his eyes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Oh, God!! 135

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greenbush withdraws the instrument from Jack's ear.

dialogues.speaker: GREENBUSH
dialogues.text: Didn't see a thing, Jack. Why don't you just go home and try to get some rest. 136

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck takes his hands away from his eyes. with a vacant expression.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I'm blind... He looks around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's VW swings into the parking area of a small apartment complex. 138

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters and collapses into an easy chair in exhaustio He takes a few deep breaths and tries to forget the day's traumatic events. His eyes begin to close when...

dialogues.speaker: I CAN SEE
dialogues.text: Jack leaps from his chair. 139

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I can see! Thank God. And I was just gettin' ready to kiss my pilot's license goodbye. 140

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: stands in the middle of the room, poised for an attack from any direction.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where are you!? Who are you!?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Jack, we've got ourselves a little situation here.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You know my name!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I heard somebody call you that... right before the lights went out, so to speak. Jack rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Stay calm, Jack. Don't panic. Take your doctor's advice: Get some rest. Jack charges into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 141 41.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: where he throws open the medicine cabinet and begins to rummage through the bottles. He finds one; looks at it. 142

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: sees the bottle's label.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Sleeping pills! 143

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (alarmed) It even sees what I'm doing!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Don't take those!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm going to sleep for a little while. Not long. Say, two or three days. And when I wake up, if you're not gone -TUCK'S VOICE Wait! Don't! Listen to me: You're not crazy. I'm real! And I've only got a 24-hour air supply to begin with, so don't go to sleep on me! Jack pops the pills into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Too late. 144

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You fool! If I was normal size and outside of you instead of inside of you, I'd hit you so hard your grandchildren would be born with broken noses! (then; to Computer) Quick! The fastest way to the stomach!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: The stomach?... Yech! 145

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: stares into his medicine cabinet mirror, as if searching his reflection for some clue to his sudden insanity. Then it hits him: No more "voice."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 Voice? No reply. 146 42.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you still there? Jack seems pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pod RIPS into the stomach through the convoluted folds of the stomach wall. 147

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We share Tuck's view through the dome as the Pod hurtles into the foaming torrent of the stomach. The gastric glands secrete their caustic juices and hydrochloric acid bubbles up in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: HERE COME THE SLEEPING PILLS
dialogues.text: Huge, gelatin capsules filled with multi-colored granules They tumble down into the stomach headed straight for the Tuck swings a Laser-gun Sighting-Device into position. He takes aim and FIRES. Direct hits. The capsules VAPORIZE on the spot, exploding 148

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters. But he stops to rub his stomach. He feels a queasy sensation down there. He lies down on the sofa to

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You jerk! Are you trying to kill us both!? How many of those pills did you take, anyway!? Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's back.  Revised 11/8/85 43.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You bet I'm back. Jack puts his hands over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm not listening to you.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Please! Jack! Jack begins to HUM to himself to cover Tuck's voice.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: We have to talk! Jack!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I think I'll watch some TV!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: No you won't!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Try and stop me! Ha! Jack picks up the remote control and turns on the TV. 149

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: hits the Electromagnetic Booster Button and -- 150

dialogues.speaker: THE TELEVISION
dialogues.text: shuts off. 151

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: turns it on again. But again, Tuck turns it off. Jack tur it on again. Tuck turns it off. On. Off. On. Off. On. Off. Okay! 152

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Forget the TV!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: He's really pissed off now.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: No, no! Watch TV! Enjoy yourself! Watch TV! Tuck holds down both Electromagnetic Buttons. 153

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of blinding white light! VOLUME. The TV comes on -- FULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 44. The channels begin to change -- faster and faster. picture is just a blur. The The indoor antenna shoots out to its longest extension and begins to WHIP around the air like a scorpion's tail. The volume grows LOUDER and LOUDER. down on the table. The TV BANGS up and Jack watches all this with stunned, open-mouthed horror. Then: POPPING and HISSING.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, noooooo!! The TV EXPLODES. The sofa is blown over backwards and Jack goes flying with it. Jack lies there on the rug, breathing heavily. 154

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: is also out of breath. Jack and Tuck are like two fighter who have pummeled each other into total exhaustion, but a both unwilling to concede defeat.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (very sympathetically) Jack, I think we've really gotten this relationship off on the wrong foot. 155

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: makes no reply. He just tries to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I am real, Jack. You do believe that now, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I -- I want to.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Believe it, Jack, because it's true. (beat) Did you ever see that movie where Tony Curtis and Sidney Poitier are handcuffed together? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Well, that's us, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 45.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yeah. 156

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: We're in this together and we have to help each other. (beat) You don't work at the lab, do you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I work at Ralph's Market.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: And you don't know anything about the experiment, do you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What experiment?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (softly; as his worst fears are confirmed) Shit. (then) Jack... my name is Pendelton. Tuck Pendelton. Captain, United States Navy. I'm involved in a miniaturization experiment. I was supposed to be placed inside a rabbit, but somehow I got inside you instead. 157

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: rests his forehead against the wall. Wow. 158

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What a day I'm having...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. David Niles is behind the wheel. Pete Blanchard. His passenger is

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: We're late. We've missed the best part of the experiment.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Relax, would ya? (lights a cigarette) By the way -- who's your guy?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 46.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Your guy inside the Your pilot? pod?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Somebody you know, I think. (beat) Captain Tuck Pendelton. Oh. Blanchard gives Niles a look of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Pendelton...? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: (concerned) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. Except Tuck Pendelton's got the worst attitude problem in military history. He's been drummed out of every space program since Gemini -- and he drinks like a fish. (long pause) However... the dumb sonofabitch did save my life once. Niles gives Blanchard a look.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: He pulled me out of my space capsule when it caught fire on the pad. (beat) Of course the only reason he got to me so fast was because he had sneaked into a restricted area where he wasn't allowed. 159

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe's dented and battered Black Sedan is parked next to a large, but inconspicuous-looking warehouse. 160

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually a scientific laboratory. Why beat around the bush, this is the Bad Guy's Secret Lab. And some of the Bad Guys are currently present: Igoe and his Henchmen. Several LAB TECHS. And DR. MARGARE CANKER -- an unusually glamorous-looking scientist. They are all gathered around a TV MONITOR watching the VIDEOTAPE made of the miniaturization experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 47.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: There's two chips! It's a dual chip system! We have one.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Where's the other?

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: In the Pod.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: But, where's the Pod?? Just then, another Lab Tech shows up with some ENLARGED P (From the camera taken from the Camera Shop Customer.) The first enlargement shows the hypodermic needle actuall entering Jack's backside. The second enlargement shows Jack's face.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: The Pod's in him. Canker looks at the photo of Jack, then turns to Igoe.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Find him! 161

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS with whirling red bubble lights. AMBULANCES. CORONER'S VANS. A crowd of ONLOOKERS. POLICE OFFICERS holding them back, setting up barricades. TV NEWS CREWS arriving. Jack shoulders his way to the very front of the crowd. He gets there just in time to see bodies -- draped in white sheets -- being wheeled from the lab on gurneys to waitin ambulances and coroner's vans. 162

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: views the situation on his monitor; his expression regist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tries to stop a POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Officer... excuse me, Officer. What's going on --- get back!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Stay back! The Policeman hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Tuck) Did you hear that? Yeah. 164

dialogues.speaker: TUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gimme a minute to think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspaper reporters and TV Crews have been allowed past t police line. One of these reporters is Lydia. She muscles her way up to Pete Blanchard who is emerging from the bui Pete!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Just a few questions!

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say, Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Isn't it true that Vector-Scope Laboratories was working on a secret Satellite Missile Tracking System for the Defense Department?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: That's absolutely untrue. you can quote me on that. (to Police) Get the press back. And The Police do as instructed, herding the Press back behin police lines. Lydia is forced back, and she finds herself standing dire in front of Jack. (Who is, of course, a total stranger to her.) Jack's nose is within inches of Lydia's hair.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 165 49.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Smells something strange coming in through his air vents. He sniffs, then turns the air jets so that they shoot directly at his face. He sniffs again.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Midnight Lace...? Then, he sees something on his monitor: past. Dr. Niles hurrying

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Dr. Niles... (to Jack) ... Follow that short guy with the curly hair and glasses! 166

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: begins to move through the crowd, trying to keep up with Niles who is on the other side of the police barricade.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Dr. Niles. He runs the lab. Don't let him out of your sight. If we can just talk to him -JACK -- Lost him! Niles ducks into his parked car and slams the door behind him. 167

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: views the scene on his monitor.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: He's not driving off. There's someone in the car with him. Is this as close as you can get? 168

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: is about thirty yards away from the parked car. of onlookers surrounds him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. A crush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 50.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Keep looking at the car.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: begins to make some frantic adjustments to the dials on his console.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Look directly at them! Don't turn your head. I think I can beef up this reception a little... Suddenly: NILES' VOICE is heard loud and clear over the Pod's speaker:

dialogues.speaker: NILES' VOICE
dialogues.text: ... my God... what happened in there...?!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: That's it! 170

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: looks startled. Hey!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can hear them! I know. 171

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Now shut up and listen...

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: You've been hit good. Professional work. Who'd want to do this to you?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Anybody -- or any country -- that wants to leapfrog a decade's worth of research. Blanchard looks very distressed.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: I hope you know that we can't get involved in this. You're on your own now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 172 51.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: reacts to the sound of Blanchard's voice. He looks closel at his monitor, but sun glares off the car's windshield, hiding Blanchard's face.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (to himself) I know that voice... 173

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: ... We've got to keep our hands clean. This is your baby... you change the dirty diapers.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: But... what about Pendelton?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: He's out there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: (coldly) Pendelton's been around the military long enough to know that every mission contains an element of risk.

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: He saved your life once! 174

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Pete Blanchard!... 175

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do to help Pendelton now. The chip's gone and his air supply runs out in -(checks his watch) -- almost twenty hours. (a beat) Start the car. Get me out of here. 176

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: watches as Blanchard and Niles drive away.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sounds like you're being kissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 177 52.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: is silent. But the expression of betrayal he wears speaks volumes. 178

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia returns to her car where her colleague DUANE FLORNO (a well-dressed black man) is waiting. Duane stands outsi the car holding the business end of the car's short-wave radio in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUANE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Blanchard's stone-walling. He knows more than he's telling.

dialogues.speaker: DUANE
dialogues.text: Guess who's arriving at the airport in exactly four hours?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (after a moment) The Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: DUANE
dialogues.text: You got it. Lydia smiles knowingly, glances back at the Vector-Scope Lab, then turns to face Duane again.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: The pieces are beginning to fall into place. 179

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the HUM of the ENGINES. CAMERA MOVES DOWN aisle, eventually DISCOVERS a pair of snake-skin cowboy boots. CAMERA PANS UP, taking in blue jeans, suede Western sport coat, bib-front shirt and felt Stetson hat. This is the COWBOY. But dispite his name and his dress, his looks are distinctly foreign: Prominent nose and cheekbones, pointy chin and dark, bushy eyebrows.
