dialogues.text: Okay. Jack approaches Lydia. She looks at him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (repeating Tuck's words) Lydia... you were right. I do fight too much, and I do drink too much, and I have ruined everything that's good in my life. (beat) You were the best thing in it, Lydia. And I threw you away, too. I'm a big dumb Palooka... just like you said I was. Lydia is convinced. Her mouth drops open and her eyes moisten. She's looking at Jack, but she's seeing Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Oh, Tuck... it is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised 11/8/85 106. She throws her arms around Jack's neck. Jack isn't sure what to do with his arms. He steps back from Lydia. Okay!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wait a minute here! Lydia looks perplexed, as well she might considering the situation.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Tuck, I want a moment alone!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shut down your sensors. No picture.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S
dialogues.text: Bad idea, Jack. I'd dark. And what if I contact? No, Jack. No sound.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: be navigating in the couldn't restore I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I want a moment alone.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Alone with Lydia, you mean!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You owe me this, Tuck! It dawns on Lydia that she's in the middle. Okay, Jack. Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Signing off. Tuck cuts out. Jack can feel a change in his body: A momentary sensation of freedom that is reflected in his expression. He takes Lydia's hands in both his own.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Lydia... I'm not sure what I want to say to you. I've only known you for less than a day, but -LOUD FOOTSTEPS are heard co

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, no time for words! Jack impulsively takes Lydia in his arms and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 356 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swirling and spinning. Caught in a whirlpool; a maelstrom 357

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck fights for control of the craft. What he sees outsid his viewing dome resembles an undersea view of the crashi surf. But in truth... it is mere human saliva. 358

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack breaks the kiss and Lydia's eyes remain closed. Then the door is thrown open and Igoe stands framed in the doo

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Let's go! 359

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is trying frantically to restore communications to his Pod.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Jack? Do you read me? (beat) Damn! No reception! I knew I shouldn't have shut down my sensors! (looks out his viewing dome) Where am I, anyway? Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of Bell Jet Ranger helicopters fly over the landsc heading toward San Francisco. 361

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrimshaw, Dr. Canker and a Henchman Pilot.  Revised 11/8/85 362 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Lydia, Igoe and another Henchman Pilot. Lydia exchange worried glances. Jack and Meanwhile... 363

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling swiftly down a twisting channel whose sides are made up of delicate, convoluted folds. The flood lights atop the Pod illuminate the way. 364

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck looks out the viewing dome. The twisting channel is opening into a dark, hollow chamber. And then Tuck sees something more incredible than anythin he has ever seen in his entire life. His eyes widen and h jaw drops open in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Oh my God... This is what Tuck sees: 365

dialogues.speaker: A HUMAN FETUS
dialogues.text: Eight weeks old. Curled in its sac of amniotic fluid. A tiny, unformed human being. Almost transparent. 366

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sails up to the fetus in the sac -- which in reality is only one inch long, but dwarfs the Pod like a giant. 367

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: views the fetus. Awed and overwhelmed by the miracle of human life. Moved. Speechless. Then it hits him:

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (hushed) Lydia... 368

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopters land atop the warehouse situated on the d Everyone piles out and disappears down a rooftop access. 369

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Lydia are ushered into the lab. Busy Technicians are involved with their work. Canker leads everyone to:

dialogues.speaker: A POD
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 109. resting on a platform. It looks very much like Tuck's Pod except its color is a flat, metallic black. We will call the BLACK POD.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: There it is!

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Our Pod. Perhaps not as sophisticated as the one inside Mr. Putter, but I think it will get the job done. Jack and Lydia exchange a puzzled glance.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: What job?

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: We'll use the chip we have. Mr. Igoe will be placed in our Pod, miniaturized and injected into Mr. Putter. He will then locate their Pod, eliminate its pilot by whatever means necessary, take command of it and retrieve the second chip. Jack and Lydia's expressions darken.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Prepare the miniaturizer!

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: Where can we stash the girl?

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Use my office. Scrimshaw signals to the Henchman who whisks Lydia away. Jack is taken to a stainless steel table and lashed down.  Revised 11/8/85 370 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia and the Henchman enter the office. pushes Lydia toward a chair. The Henchman

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Just sit down and shut up. Lydia does as she's told. 371

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe is now seated inside the Black Pod.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Engage the PEM 5000!

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: PEM functional.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Lower the Miniaturization Cone! A clear glass cone is lowered from above, engulfing the Pod. Jack watches in wide-eyed wonderment. 372

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia snakes her hand into her purse. Suddenly, she's on feet with the electronic stun-gun pointed at the Henchman

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Stay right where you are! This is an electronic stun-gun. A nonlethal personal defense weapon deploying a charge of five thousand vo-- oh, what the hell... ZAP! She fires the gun. Five thousand volts enter the Henchman's body. He sinks to his knees, but doesn't fall forward. He just kneels there: Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia grabs the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Duane! It's me, Lydia. Listen carefully. I'm being held in a warehouse somewhere along the Embarcadero. You've got to reach Pete Blanchard for me! 373

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane Flornoy is on the phone. Blanchard?! police!

dialogues.speaker: FLORNOY
dialogues.text: Hell, I'll call the

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Yes! Call the police. But call Blanchard, too. Tell him we've got Tuck Pendelton!

dialogues.speaker: FLORNOY
dialogues.text: Tuck who?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Pendelton. He'll understand. Tell him we're coming in with Tuck. Dr. Niles has got to get ready for us at Vector-Scope.

dialogues.speaker: FLORNOY
dialogues.text: Lydia... are you in as much trouble as you sound?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Maybe more. (beat) Tell the police to look for the warehouse with the helicopters on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: FLORNOY
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Thanks, Duane. Lydia hangs up the phone. She glances around the office, spots Canker's lab coat hanging from a hook. She puts it She goes to the stunned Henchman, takes the pistol from u his coat and slips it into her pocket. Then she exits the office. As the door SLAMS behind her, the kneeling Henchm CRASHES face-first onto the floor. 374

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia moves briskly down the hallway. She arrives at an intersection and stops to look both ways before proceedin

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Lydia. Lydia GASPS, jumps and spins around.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: What the hell!? -TUCK'S VOICE Lydia, it's me -- Tuck.  Revised 11/8/85 112.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Tuck, where are... (it hits her) Oh, no. But... how?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You must have kissed Jack, Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I only... I mean, he kissed me, but...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: That's not important. We've got to get that chip. My time is running out.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: What about Jack?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: We don't leave without him. 375

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia slips in unnoticed, wearing the lab coat. stands among the other technicians. She Jack is strapped to the table. Canker looms over him with a long hypodermic needle. Jack tries to wiggle free.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Ready to inject the Pod into the subject.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. After Igoe takes command of their Pod, how do we get the chip out?

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Mr. Igoe will pilot the Pod out through a tear duct or sweat gland.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: Why chance it? As soon as he takes over the Pod and gets the chip, let's re-enlarge!

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: While it's still inside Mr. Putter!?

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: Sure. Jack and Lydia react in horror.  Revised 11/8/85 113.

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what kind of mess that would make? Hearing this, Jack struggles valiantly against his bindings.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Tuck! Give me some adrenaline! Make me strong, Tuck! Jack strains and strains and strains. His veins pop out in his neck, and... SNAP! SNAP! SNAP! SNAP! He frees himself. Look!

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: He's loose! Grab him! Lab Technicians rush forward to seize Jack. manfully, but there are too many of them. He struggles Canker jabs the needle into Jack's arm and injects Igoe and the Black Pod into his body. He's in!

dialogues.speaker: CANKER
dialogues.text: Igoe's in! Lydia pulls out the pistol taken from the Henchman and FIRES it into the air. Everyone jumps.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Let go of him! There are no heroes here, only scientists and engineers. They release Jack immediately. Lydia comes over to his si

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Scrimshaw) So! You wanted to enlarge the Pod while it was still inside me, huh! Well, let's see who has the last laugh now! (beat) Everybody into the miniaturizer! 376

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS speed through the streets, SIRENS SOUNDING. 377

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Held at gunpoint, Scrimshaw, Canker and the Lab Techs watch the Miniaturization Cone descend down upon them.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIMSHAW
dialogues.text: I'll get you for this, Margaret! The Cone fully engulfs them now.  Revised 11/8/85 114.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's go! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: The chip! Jack goes back to the circuit board, finds the chip and yanks it free.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I'll take that now. Jack looks up -- sees that the Henchman who Lydia stunned returned. And he's got an automatic rifle pointed at him.

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Hand it over. Jack doesn't want to give up the chip. An idea hits him:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Here it comes, Tuck! So saying, he pops the chip into his mouth and swallows i At the same moment, Lydia comes up behind the Henchman an clubs him over the head with her gun. He once again sinks to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Let's go! They make a dash for a corridor, SLAMMING a heavy metal DOOR behind them. 378

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Where's the chip!?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I swallowed it! Lydia winces to herself. Now they realize that they have sealed themselves into a dead-end hallway. But they spot a ladder that leads to a trap door in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: The roof!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's go! 379

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge onto the roof and see the parked helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: It's our only chance.  Revised 11/8/85 115. Then they see that the choppers are being guarded by another Henchman.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Tuck's given me the strength of ten men! I'll handle this.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: But -TUCK'S VOICE -- don't tell him now! Jack leaps at the Henchman with flying feet and fists-of- WHAM! BAM! POW! The Henchman goes flying off the roof. 380

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Henchman who Lydia clubbed with her gun has regained consciousness, and now staggers out into the alley with his automatic rifle. He looks up -- sees his comrade falling from the sky. BOOM! The falling Henchman lands on top of the other one, knocking them both out cold. 381

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Lydia board one of the choppers and strap themse

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C'mon, Tuck! Tell me how to fly this thing!

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Jack -JACK -- not now, Lydia! instructions! Tuck, give me

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: He can't, Jack! He's not in you anymore! He's in me! Jack looks flabbergasted. It takes him a moment to recover.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: For how long?...

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Since the wine cellar.  Revised 11/8/85 116.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (sounding like Jerry Lewis) You mean... when I broke... and when I hit... and when he fell over the thing... it wasn't Tuck who...

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: It was you, Jack. All you. But we better get this thing in the air.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Lydia! I'm on the tip of your tongue! Get me back into Jack! Kiss him! Lydia grabs Jack and plants one on his lips. His eyes widen into saucers as Lydia's tongue goes into his mouth. 382

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Propelled with a mighty force, in a swirl of foaming saliva, back into Jack's body. 383

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia breaks the kiss. Wow!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What was that for!?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hi, buddy!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh. 384

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Jack, turn on the master switch. Disengage the clutch, then start the ignition. You've got two sticks at your sides. One for each hand. Here's what they're for... 385

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE burst in, but stop short at the sight of the weirdly-shimmering Miniaturization Cone.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Stay back, men! He pulls a handle and the Cone begins to rise. The Police watch with bated breath until Canker, Scrimshaw and the L Techs are fully revealed: Each one about two feet tall.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 117.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Captain... munchkins! 386

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper lifts off into the sky. 387

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Henchmen are coming to their senses. They look up, see the chopper flying off. They clamber up a fire escape toward the rooftop and the second chopper. 388

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It flies erratically out over the Bay, then practically drops from the sky, plunging toward the water. Then, only several feet from the water's surface, it levels off and begins to gain altitude. 389

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has a firm grip on both sticks, if not the situation itself. 390

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Keep your RPMs in the green, Jack! I've got to reach that microchip before the other guy does. He turns to one of his display monitors. It shows a wire- image of Jack's body. Two lights are blinking. One repres the chip, the other represents the Black Pod.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Player Number Two is taking the digestive system.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Right. But I can beat him by taking the circulatory system, can't I?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes. But that means going through the heart, Player Number One!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I know... but it's worth a shot. (to Jack) I'm going through the heart, Jack. It could get hairy in there. Your pulse rate is up to one hundred and seventy. My pod might not withstand the beating.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 391 117A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coursing through the soft muscle tissue that resembles huge strands of wire rope. Igoe is visible through the cockpit dome.  Revised 11/8/85 392 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe checks his instruments. Sonar "Blips" pin-point the location of the chip and Tuck's Pod. Igoe is surprised by what he sees:

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Ha, ha! You fool! You'll never make it through the heart! 393

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Henchmen take off in the second chopper. 394

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's chopper almost clips the top of the bridge. 395

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was close! (beat) How do I find Vector-Scope?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Follow the freeways! 396

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding at a low altitude over the freeway. lower and lower... 397 Getting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Lydia in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I said follow the freeway, not take the freeway!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can't get it back up into the -LYDIA -- Jack, look!! 398

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are fast approaching the mouth of the Bay Bridge tun -- flying only inches above the traffic below them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, nooooo! 399

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHOPPER ROARS into the tunnel above the traffic. Motorists gawk and brake -- TIRES SCREECH, HORNS BLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper emerges from the tunnel and begins to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: floating through Jack's stomach, headed for the small intestine. 402

dialogues.speaker: THE POD
dialogues.text: sailing through the pulmonary veins toward the left ventr of the heart. 403

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK POD
dialogues.text: sliding down the endlessly long esophagus toward the stom 404

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Try to slow down your pulse rate! I'm about to enter the left ventricle! 405

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying backwards across the sky. 406

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Lydia look stunned as they speed through the air in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm in! I'm in the ventricle, Jack. Stay calm, stay calm. Jack tries to take a deep, calming breath when the enemy chopper, piloted by the Henchmen, appears in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Jack, over there! Jack turns, sees the enemy chopper.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (startled) Aaahhh! 407

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's fear causes a sudden rush of blood into the ventri followed by strong ventricle contractions. The Pod is buffeted and tossed like a beer can in the pounding surf.  Revised 11/8/85 408 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck fights for control of his craft. It shakes and vibra Interior lights dim and flash. It seems the Pod will tear apart at the seams. Tuck almost blacks out. 409 Then he sees:

dialogues.speaker: THE AORTIC ARCH
dialogues.text: offering four distinct pathways out of the heart. 410

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: The aortic arch! I'm almost out! I've got to make it through the opening on the right! He pulls hard on the control stick. The Pod begins to tur It trembles and shakes. Portions of the sidewalls are pus inward by the tremendous pressure. Gauges shatter. Warnin lights flash and BUZZ. 411

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAMMING against the muscle-lined vascular wall. Bouncing back. Shooting through the proper "archway" into the relative calm of the AORTA.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm through! 412

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe views his sonar scanner in disbelief. The "Blip" tells him that Tuck has made it safely through the heart.

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Impossible! 413

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's Pod BLASTS through the membrane lining of the stomach wall.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm in the stomach. No sign of the bandit. 414

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe enters the stomach. He can see Tuck's Pod up ahead. He swings his Laser Gun Sighting Device into place.  Revised 11/8/85 415 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and the enemy chopper are engaged in a nasty dogfigh The Henchman FIRES at Jack's chopper with his automatic rifle. Somehow, Jack is able to maneuver out of the line of fire. 416

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dogfight of a different kind rages here. Both Pods dart around the stomach, shooting LASER BEAMS at each other. A stray laser beam hits the stomach wall, burning a small hole in it. 417

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack winces and grabs his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Are you all right!? Then: The enemy chopper comes up right beside Jack. The Henchman inside levels his automatic weapon, but before he can fire -- 418

dialogues.speaker: A HUEY-COBRA U.S. MILITARY HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: THUNDERS out of the clouds like a bad dream and FIRES a heat-seeking missile. The missile SCREAMS across the skies and hits the enemy chopper. It EXPLODES in a ball of fire and evaporates into dust. 419

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND LYDIA
dialogues.text: watch it happen with dazed expressions. 420

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete Blanchard, wearing his military uniform, is on the radio-phone.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: That one was for Tuck, Lydia! You can tell him I've put my uniform back on. (beat) We're taking you in, Lydia. Follow us down. 421

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the two Pods play cat-and-mouse through the corridors of the GASTRIC GLANDS in the upper stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck gets the edge on Igoe -- FIRES his laser. Direct hit!  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 422

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Got 'im!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Nice shooting, Player Number One.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Stop calling me that! This isn't a video game -- this is real life!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: I agree, Player Number One. (beat) Advance to the second level. 121A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corrosive hydrochloric acid pours into the Pod through the hole blasted by Tuck's laser beam. Damn!

dialogues.speaker: IGOE
dialogues.text: Stomach acid! The interior of the Black Pod is being rapidly eaten away. It looks bad for Igoe. 424

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's Pod locates the chip at the opening of the intesti but the chip is many times larger than the Pod. Nonethele the Pod's articulating arms reach out and take hold of it 425

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zipping along beside the giant Huey-Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I've got the chip.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Lydia) He's got it! Lydia gives a silent cheer.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm coming up the esophagus with it. I'm gonna plant it right on your tongue. How much farther to Vector-Scope? Jack looks down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're over San Jose now. your air supply? 426 How's

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: glances at his mission clock.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes. 427

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igoe abandons his disintegrating Pod and swims out into the caverns of the upper stomach. Tuck's Pod sails by, pushing the enormous chip before it. Igoe waits for the right moment -- then grabs hold of Tuck's Pod. He clings on tightly, crawls to the top and pries open the hatch with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 428 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck swivels in his chair to see Igoe entering the Pod. Igoe's mighty hands clamp down around Tuck's neck. The fight is on! 429

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BATTALION OF U.S. INFANTRY SOLDIERS have assembled in the parking lot. Duane Flornoy is there as well. The two choppers appear in the sky. the first to touch down. 430 The Huey-Cobra is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How do I land this thing!? (no reply) Tuck! (no reply) Can't anything ever be easy!? 431

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Igoe duke it out. not Igoe's. 432 Tuck's face is bloodied, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving swiftly up the esophagus with the chip, even as Tuck and Igoe struggle inside. 433

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's chopper comes down hard. Blanchard, Flornoy and Infantrymen rush to help Jack and Lydia out. Everyone then dashes into the lab. 434

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Igoe slam against the pod's various instruments. Tuck puts his hand to his jumpsuit pocket. Shit!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You broke my lucky flask! An exposed WIRE BUZZES. Igoe leaps back from it like a scared child. Tuck is surprised by this reaction.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Afraid of a little electricity, huh! Igoe can't take his eyes off the CRACKLING WIRE. takes advantage of the distraction and: Tuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 124. Drives his fist into Igoe's stomach. In fact, Tuck hits Igoe so hard that his arm sinks into Igoe's body clear up to his elbow! Tuck looks horrified. He pulls his arm out. And with it, much of Igoe's inner workings: Wires, circuits, relays, diodes, switches. They all come tumbling out in one big tangled, HUMMING, heap.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: An android! Igoe begins to short-circuit. Smoke billows out from all the openings in his body. A HISSING noise. SPARKING WIRES Then, Igoe erupts into flames. Tuck jumps back. CAMERA MOVES IN CLOSE ON IGOE'S TATTOO. Flames shrivel and melt the "skin" on Igoe's chest, and the heart-shaped tattoo with Margaret's name in the cente begins to perish. 435

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: grabs an onboard extinguisher and tries to douse the fire Igoe is melting right before his eyes and the pod is fill with an acrid black smoke. The air-supply gauge begins to flash WARNING!, WARNING!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: The fire is consuming your remaining air! The fire is consuming your remaining air!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Where are we now!?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Middle esophagus! Too far to go! Not enough air! Only one chance to make it! What!?

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: A human sneeze has been clocked at over one hundred miles per hour. Tuck turns to his mike:

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Jack -- sneeze!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 436 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where it all began. Jack. Dr. Niles and his technicians surround

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Tuck) Sneeze?? I can't sneeze! 437

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You have to! Think allergies! Ragweed! Pollen! Cat fur! Uh...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Fungus spores! Dust mites! Animal dander! 438

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S EYES
dialogues.text: begin to tear up and redden.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah... ahhh... 439

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: braces himself. He can feel the sneeze coming. The pod begins to tremble as Jack's respiratory system starts to convulse.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: No power in the world like the power of suggestion! 440

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh -- Chooooo!! 441

dialogues.speaker: THE POD
dialogues.text: is no more than a blur as it rockets up the esophagus at near "warp speed." 442

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: is pressed flat against the pod's rear wall -- his face horribly contorted by the powerful forward thrust. 443

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S NOSE AND MOUTH
dialogues.text: The sneeze explodes out in SLOW MOTION. A glistening spray of mucous and saliva containing both the chip and the Pod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 126. ... All of which SPLATTERS against the face and glasses o Dr. Niles. NORMAL SPEED RESUMES as Technicians rush to Niles.

dialogues.speaker: TECH ONE
dialogues.text: There's the chip! It's sliding down Nile's cheek. They quickly remove it, then search Niles' face for the Pod.

dialogues.speaker: TECH TWO
dialogues.text: Bring a slide! I see it! The Pod is placed on a glass slide. Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: NILES
dialogues.text: Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: TECH THREE
dialogues.text: Re-enlarger functional! Niles presses a button. Lights flash in the lab. An incredible HIGH-PITCHED WHISTLE is heard. Everyone is forced to cover their ears. And then: 444

dialogues.speaker: THE POD APPEARS
dialogues.text: Full-sized. Standing in the middle of the lab. Dented and battered. Dripping with gooey biochemical waste material and glandular secretions. Smoke pours from its vents.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHARD
dialogues.text: Fire on board! Blanchard rushes forward to open the hatch. 445

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: holds a handkerchief to his nose and mouth, waiting for the hatch to open.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Player Number One... Tuck gives the computer a farewell glance.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: ... Good game. The hatch is then popped open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 446 126A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck scrambles from the hatch with Blanchard's assistance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! All scatter.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: It's going to blow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tuck suddenly goes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chip! Tuck goes to the nose of the pod and tries to pull out the circuit module containing the second chip. It doesn't come free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Technicians and Infantrymen come forward, but Tuck warns them back.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Get back! They jump away. Finally, Tuck pulls the module free and he dives for safety. The POD EXPLODES. Everyone hits the floor. The lab fills with debris. But when the smoke clears, one-by-one all get to their feet. First Blanchard. Then Niles. Then Lydia. Then Tuck. Then Flornoy. Then Jack. Tuck is a mess. His face bloodied and bruised. jumpsuit torn, burned and sweat-stained. His But Lydia rushes into his arms nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Tuck!! Tuck lifts her off her feet.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia! Then, looking over Lydia's shoulder, Tuck sees Jack. He s Lydia gently back on her feet. She sees who he is looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck regards Jack with an expression of deep affection and profound appreciation. He steps towards him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Glad to have you back, Captain.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 126B. Tuck ignores the hand to give Jack an enormous bear hug. Technicians and Infantrymen CHEER. Lydia wipes a tear from her eye. Now, everyone closes in on Tuck to welcome him back. Lydia and Jack become lost in the crowd. But soon... Tuck wiggles free and takes Lydia aside.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia, we have to talk in private. Tuck takes her into Niles' office, which is visible to the lab proper through a large glass window. 447

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (urgently) I never got to go up in a space capsule, Lydia. I never got to orbit the Earth or walk on the moon... but I've just gone places where no man has ever gone before. I've done things, and seen things, Lydia, that have opened my eyes. To you... to life... to everything! Lydia looks confused and overwhelmed. down a little. Tuck tries to slow

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: It's not too late for me, Lydia. I can change. I can be better. I'm a different man already... (beat) ... I've known all along. Why couldn't I just admit it to myself?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Admit what, Tuck?...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: That I'm in love with you, of course. Lydia is bowled over.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Boy...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You broke my heart that morning you drove off and left me.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: You are a changed man, Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Lydia... this is a personal question, but I've got to know. Since that last night we spent together... have you spent a night like that with anyone else? 126C.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Tuck!

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Please, Lydia. It's important to me. Lydia can see that Tuck means it.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: All right, Tuck... (beat) No. I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (surprised) You haven't?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: (defensively) I've been pretty busy, don't forget.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: (after a pause) We're going to have a baby, you know. Lydia gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: You did know, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure...

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Be sure, Lydia. (beat) I've seen it. Lydia begins to smile.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Is it a boy or a girl? Tuck smiles back at her. around her waist. Approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: I didn't even notice. have to wait and see. Puts his arms We'll just Lydia wraps her arms around his neck. For a moment they just look into each others eyes. Then they kiss. 448

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks through the glass window into Niles' office. He sees Tuck and Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 Then, they spot him. come after him. Jack turns away. 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia and Tuck

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Jack -LYDIA -- Wait! Jack stops, turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You don't have to say anything. I know you're in love with each other. Tuck and Lydia feel good and bad at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look... this has been the most exciting twenty-four hours of my life. I've been chased, kidnapped, frozen, electrified, amplified, magnetized and terrorized -- and I haven't felt this good since high school. (smiles sweetly) It wasn't rest I needed... it was adventure. And for one day it was mine. (to both Tuck and Lydia) We made a good team, didn't we? Lydia smiles and gives Jack a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lydia stand together on the deck. Tuck wears a tuxedo and high hat. Lydia wears a wedding dress. The air is filled with flying confetti and brightly-colored strea A BAND PLAYS. Tuck cups his hands around his mouth and calls off:

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: Thanks again for the cruise tickets! 450

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is on the dock along with a hundred other people who have gathered to see the ship off.  INNERSPACE - Rev. 12/3/85 129.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Bon voyage! (beat) Happy honeymoon! The ship's HORN BLOWS and the ship begins to pull away from the dock. 451

dialogues.speaker: TUCK AND LYDIA
dialogues.text: give Jack a final farewell wave -- then turn to each other and kiss. 452

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks away from the deck and the departing ship toward the red Ferrari which is parked nearby. Jack tosses the keys in his hand as he approaches. 453

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack climbs in behind the wheel. sits there. For a moment, he just Then he reaches into the glove compartment and takes out white silk scarf, wraparound sunglasses, pigskin driving gloves and tweed motoring cap. He puts it all on and FIRE up the Ferrari's powerful engine. Then, one final touch: pocket. 454 He takes a cassette from his

dialogues.speaker: CASSETTE
dialogues.text: Sam Cooke's Greatest Hits. 455

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: slides the cassette into the tape player and turns the VOLUME WAY UP.

dialogues.speaker: SAM COOKE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (singing) Cu-pid... draw back your bow-oo and let... your arrow go-oo straight to... my lover's heart for me-eee. Jack listens for a moment. Smiles to himself. Then shifts the CAR into gear and SQUEALS away in a cloud of dust. FADE OUT.
